newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds rise after jobless report.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds rise after jobless report.

text.p: Argentine bonds were higher late Friday, tracking U.S. Treasuries up after a well received January U.S. jobless report.
A trader said activity was light throughout the session but as some players were short going into the jobless report, there were sufficient buyers to lift prices higher.
Argentina's FRB Brady bond due 2005 rose 1/4 to 90-1/2, while the dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 rose $0.10 to 125.95.
Another trader said: "Here I am waiting for the correction that is not coming."
Many market players have been predicting a correction this week considering the sharp rally in January and the current tight spread to U.S. Treasuries.

Many still expect the market to correct, particularly considering the slim volumes in recent sessions evidencing caution by many investors. But, the second trader said: "I think we have to wait a couple of sessions before the market's trend becomes clearer."
Call money rates were unchanged at 6.0 percent.
